node.title: Wānaka A&P show to go ahead
node.description: One of the South Island's biggest agricultural shows will go ahead next year, bucking the trend of widespread cancellations of A&P shows around the country.

node.title: Biden to Nominate Shalanda Young as Budget Director
node.description: Ms. Young, the acting head of the Office of Management and Budget, would be the first Black woman to hold the post on a permanent basis.

node.title: Pentagon Forms a Group to Examine Unexplained Aerial Sightings
node.description: The announcement follows a report that failed to clarify strange phenomena observed by military pilots and others over the past two decades.

node.title: Native American Tribes Lobbying For Return of 6000 Remains Receive Boost in Their Case
node.description: After a discovery, tribal officials said the University of Alabama will violate federal law if the items retrieved are not given back to the tribes.

node.title: Energy Secretary Slams Big Oil's 'Enormous Profits' as Travelers Face Sticker Shock
node.description: "The oil companies have taken advantage of [the] moment," the secretary said.

node.title: New Mexico Lawmakers Search Ways to Entice Film Industry in Wake of Alec Baldwin Incident
node.description: Film productions in New Mexico spent $624 million in the state over the last year, which lawmakers used as a defense of the state's rebate incentive Tuesday.

node.title: Conservative Legislators Call for Audits in 50 States in Bid to Decertify Joe Biden's Win
node.description: The letter does not cite any specific instances of proven or alleged corruption.

node.title: Climate activist's jail time considered 'too harsh' by some, backed by others
node.description: Civil libertarian's don't support the 12 month jail sentence handed to a climate activist over anti-coal protests, but two politicians say it was the right move.

node.title: A2 Milk to fight second class action suit in Victoria
node.description: Speciality dairy company A2 Milk says it will vigourously defend itself against a second class action to be filed against it in the Supreme Court of Victoria.

node.title: Juul Vaping Settlement Sends Millions From Company to State Campaigns Against Its Product
node.description: Arizona has already received $22.5 million from Eonsmoke, an electronic cigarette company that has since shut down, in a different lawsuit.

node.title: Victorian child tests positive for COVID-19 after arriving in SA
node.description: South Australia has recorded its first official COVID-19 case since yesterday's opening of borders to Victoria, NSW and the ACT.

node.title: Alleged mini meth lab and firearms discovered in PNG hotel, but Australian manager won't face drug charges
node.description: Police in PNG say outdated laws have left them unable to lay drug charges against the Australian manager of a Port Moresby hotel where an alleged clandestine meth lab and illegal firearms were discovered.

node.title: Humanitarian situation worsening in Yemen's Marib conflict zone - UN
node.description: The number of displaced people in camps in Yemen's Marib province has risen nearly 10-fold since September, with over 45,000 people fleeing their homes as Houthi forces press an offensive.

node.title: Arizona Hospital Closes Operating Room so Staff Can Be Reassigned to Surging COVID Cases
node.description: The uptick in COVID cases is once again squeezing resources at hospitals as the holidays approach.

node.title: Brisbane hit with heaviest November downpour in decades as BOM warns record rainfall possible
node.description: Queensland's south-east is drenched in one of the biggest November downpours in decades as rainfall records tumble and a southern Queensland river is on flood watch.

node.title: China urges 'certain people' to stop 'politicisation' of Peng Shuai case
node.description: The Chinese government hits out at the "malicious hyping" of the Peng Shuai case, as Human Rights Watch accuses Olympic bosses of "collaboration" with the government in Beijing.

node.title: Farmers clear mice out of headers amid fears second plague looming
node.description: Floods will do little to arrest the prolific breeding of the pests that wreaked havoc on farms earlier this year, experts say, and the wet harvest will leave plenty of fodder lying around.

node.title: Rental affordability dropped in most cities during 2021, according to new report
node.description: Rents in Sydney and Melbourne remain more affordable than those in Hobart, according to the annual Rental Affordability Index. Perth has seen the greatest decline in affordability out of the capital cities.

node.title: NASA mission to change the course of an asteroid set to launch
node.description: In what is usually the stuff of movies, a rocket is to launch from Californa on a NASA mission to alter the course of an asteroid. Audio

node.title: Reserve Bank raises the official cash rate to 0.75 percent
node.description: The Reserve Bank has raised the official cash rate for the second time in two months to counter growing inflation pressures and signalled more rises next year.

node.title: Missouri Man Is Exonerated in 3 Killings After 43 Years in Prison
node.description: A judge set Kevin Strickland, 62, free on Tuesday, noting that there was no physical evidence tying him to the crimes and that the main witness against him had tried to recant her testimony.

node.title: Feds Miss Self-Imposed Deadline For Resettling Afghan Refugees Waiting in Indiana
node.description: During a news conference, Aaron Batt of the DHS said resettlement efforts have been postponed because of limited resources and the coronavirus pandemic.

node.title: Discussion document on farm emissions levies released
node.description: The partnership of primary sector organisations has proposed two options for farmers to pay for on-farm emissions from 2025.

node.title: '#BlowThemUp': Florida Rep. Not Yet Punished for Posting About Palestinians Three Months Ago
node.description: The Florida House has not acted on a complaint that called the comments "atrocious."

node.title: 7 Doctors at Anti-Vax Summit Catch COVID-19 Despite Touting Ivermectin 'Treatment'
node.description: The summit's speakers included doctors who have claimed that the COVID-19 vaccine has killed over 50,000 Americans, which fact-checkers have called "false."

node.title: The Best Thanksgiving Movies to Stream
node.description: First the food, then the movies. Here are five streaming suggestions for the holiday.

node.title: ‘Clyde’s’ Review: Sometimes a Hero Is More Than Just a Sandwich
node.description: In Lynn Nottage’s bright new comedy, cooks at a greasy spoon dream of remaking the menu — and their lives.

node.title: Woman Accused of Suffocating 6-Week-Old Son, Waiting Hours to Call 911
node.description: Crystal Czyzewski said she was "stressed out and hadn't planned on having a child" when she gave birth, the arrest warrant affidavit stated.

node.title: Former Montana State Senator Left Voicemail Threatening Hospital For Not Issuing Ivermectin
node.description: Officials allegedly tried to use their position and influence to pressure a hospital to treat an 82-year-old patient with ivermectin.

node.title: Video of 'brazen' Sydney kidnapping linked to COVID-19 jab scam released
node.description: Police release CCTV and mobile phone footage, as they hunt five men over a "targeted" daylight kidnapping that took place in Sydney in September.
